poem:
Title: Silent Voices Rise

In the shadow of academia's tower,
Among stone and law, a thwarted flower;
The young, aching for justice, made to kneel.
Through barred windows, see their zealous steel.
Arrests and whispers tinge the Boston night,
Yet their silenced plight grows in the light.
Wind whispers, "Freedom's never freely taught,"
In the alleyways of thought.
